member.name: D3D12_BLEND
member.summary: Specifies blend factors, which modulate values for the pixel shader and render target.

member.name: D3D12_BLEND.D3D12_BLEND_ZERO
member.summary: The blend factor is (0, 0, 0, 0). No pre-blend operation.

member.name: D3D12_BLEND.D3D12_BLEND_ONE
member.summary: The blend factor is (1, 1, 1, 1). No pre-blend operation.

member.name: D3D12_BLEND.D3D12_BLEND_SRC_COLOR
member.summary: The blend factor is (Rₛ, Gₛ, Bₛ, Aₛ), that is color data (RGB) from a pixel shader. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: D3D12_BLEND.D3D12_BLEND_INV_SRC_COLOR
member.summary: The blend factor is (1 - Rₛ, 1 - Gₛ, 1 - Bₛ, 1 - Aₛ), that is color data (RGB) from a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - RGB.

member.name: D3D12_BLEND.D3D12_BLEND_SRC_ALPHA
member.summary: The blend factor is (Aₛ, Aₛ, Aₛ, Aₛ), that is alpha data (A) from a pixel shader. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: D3D12_BLEND.D3D12_BLEND_INV_SRC_ALPHA
member.summary: The blend factor is ( 1 - Aₛ, 1 - Aₛ, 1 - Aₛ, 1 - Aₛ), that is alpha data (A) from a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - A.

member.name: D3D12_BLEND.D3D12_BLEND_DEST_ALPHA
member.summary: The blend factor is (Ad Ad Ad Ad), that is alpha data from a render target. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: D3D12_BLEND.D3D12_BLEND_INV_DEST_ALPHA
member.summary: The blend factor is (1 - Ad 1 - Ad 1 - Ad 1 - Ad), that is alpha data from a render target. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - A.

member.name: D3D12_BLEND.D3D12_BLEND_DEST_COLOR
member.summary: The blend factor is (Rd, Gd, Bd, Ad), that is color data from a render target. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: D3D12_BLEND.D3D12_BLEND_INV_DEST_COLOR
member.summary: The blend factor is (1 - Rd, 1 - Gd, 1 - Bd, 1 - Ad), that is color data from a render target. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - RGB.

member.name: D3D12_BLEND.D3D12_BLEND_SRC_ALPHA_SAT
member.summary: The blend factor is (f, f, f, 1); where f = min(Aₛ, 1 - Ad). The pre-blend operation clamps the data to 1 or less.

member.name: D3D12_BLEND.D3D12_BLEND_BLEND_FACTOR
member.summary: The blend factor is the blend factor set with . No pre-blend operation.

member.name: D3D12_BLEND.D3D12_BLEND_INV_BLEND_FACTOR
member.summary: The blend factor is the blend factor set with . The pre-blend operation inverts the blend factor, generating 1 - blend_factor.

member.name: D3D12_BLEND.D3D12_BLEND_SRC1_COLOR
member.summary: The blend factor is data sources both as color data output by a pixel shader. There is no pre-blend operation. This blend factor supports dual-source color blending.

member.name: D3D12_BLEND.D3D12_BLEND_INV_SRC1_COLOR
member.summary: The blend factor is data sources both as color data output by a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - RGB. This blend factor supports dual-source color blending.

member.name: D3D12_BLEND.D3D12_BLEND_SRC1_ALPHA
member.summary: The blend factor is data sources as alpha data output by a pixel shader. There is no pre-blend operation. This blend factor supports dual-source color blending.

member.name: D3D12_BLEND.D3D12_BLEND_INV_SRC1_ALPHA
member.summary: The blend factor is data sources as alpha data output by a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - A. This blend factor supports dual-source color blending.

summary.para: The blend factor is (A, A, A, A), where the constant, A, is taken from the blend factor set with .
To successfully use this constant on a target machine, the returned from capability querying must have its AlphaBlendFactorSupported set to TRUE.
The blend factor is (1 – A, 1 – A, 1 – A, 1 – A), where the constant, A, is taken from the blend factor set with .
To successfully use this constant on a target machine, the returned from capability querying must have its AlphaBlendFactorSupported set to TRUE.
